definition: Massoud (name)/Ahmed Shah Massoud (1953-2001), Tajik Afghan engineer, military man and anti-Taleban leader
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

sentences.english: Massoud denies taking money out of Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 马苏德否认自己曾带钱离开阿富汗。

sentences.english: The men were employed to look after Masoud's tomb.
sentences.chinese: 这些人受雇照看马苏德的坟墓。

sentences.english: He pulled me by the hand and we went off to the harvesting of Masood's dates.
sentences.chinese: 他牵着我的手去看人们收获马苏德的椰枣。

sentences.english: Massoud has denied taking the money out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 但马苏德否认了他曾携带这么多现金出国。

sentences.english: Your correspondent spent a night with Masoud's former bodyguards in the Panjshir.
sentences.chinese: 本报记者在潘杰希尔跟马苏德过去的保镖度过了一夜。

sentences.english: Mr. Massoud denies taking any money out of Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 马苏德否认携带任何资金出境。

definition: Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Osama bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda

pinyin: Sa4 da2 mu3 · Hou2 sai4 yin1

definition: Moussavi, Mir Hussein (1941-), candidate in Iran's disputed 2009 elections
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
